articles.headline: A Cry to Limit Chinese Imports Rings at Paper Mill
articles.snippet: U.S. paper mills are a test case for a possible confrontation with China over tariffs on imports of Chinese-made paper.
articles.abstract: U.S. paper mills are a test case for a possible confrontation with China over tariffs on imports of Chinese-made paper.
articles.lead_paragraph: LUKE, Md. — For years the residents of this economically distressed hollow in the Appalachians have watched textile mills, glass factories and tire makers close down one after the other. Now its lone remaining big factory — “the last man standing,” as the production manager at the paper mill here put it — is threatened by imports of cheaper paper made in China.

articles.headline: Pressed by U.S., Pakistan Seizes a Taliban Chief
articles.snippet: Mullah Obaidullah is the most important Taliban leader to be captured since the U.S.-led invasion of Afghanistan.
articles.abstract: Mullah Obaidullah is the most important Taliban leader to be captured since the U.S.-led invasion of Afghanistan.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, March 1 — The former Taliban defense minister was arrested in Pakistan on Monday, the day of Vice President Dick Cheney’s visit, two government officials said Thursday. He is the most important Taliban member to be captured since the American-led invasion of Afghanistan in 2001.

articles.headline: A Steadier Day for Stock Markets, but a Sense of Unease Lingers
articles.snippet: After four years of strong growth, low interest rates and prosperity, investors appear to have become too complacent about risks.
articles.abstract: After four years of strong growth, low interest rates and prosperity, investors appear to have become too complacent about risks.
articles.lead_paragraph: What is bothering investors? No one thing in particular and yet everything.
articles.byline: By Vikas Bajaj and Jeremy W. Peters

articles.headline: Can Lenders Suddenly Tighten Reins?
articles.snippet: The government may be arriving far too late to prevent damage to borrowers from subprime mortgages, and just in time for its intervention to make things worse.
articles.abstract: The government may be arriving far too late to prevent damage to borrowers from subprime mortgages, and just in time for its intervention to make things worse.
articles.lead_paragraph: When a financing technique is abused, the government has a way of riding in with rules to stop the practice. Unfortunately, it often arrives far too late to prevent the damage, and just in time for its intervention to make things worse.

articles.headline: Google Courts Small YouTube Deals, and Very Soon, a Larger One
articles.snippet: YouTube is set to announce a partnership with the BBC to create two entertainment channels and one news channel on YouTube.
articles.abstract: YouTube is set to announce a partnership with the BBC to create two entertainment channels and one news channel on YouTube.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, March 1 — Google has been frustrated in its efforts to reach comprehensive deals with major studios and networks to put their video on YouTube. But in the meantime, it is forming partnerships with hundreds of smaller media companies that see value — or at least a valuable experiment — in contributing to the site.

articles.headline: Greenspan Is Still Able to Move Markets
articles.snippet: By uttering the word “recession,” Alan Greenspan upstaged efforts by his successor to calm investors.
articles.abstract: By uttering the word “recession,” Alan Greenspan upstaged efforts by his successor to calm investors.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 1 — They are marketed as “intimate conversations” with Alan Greenspan, and groups pay about $150,000 to hear his economic outlook.

articles.headline: It’s Not Only About Price at Wal-Mart
articles.snippet: After a tumultuous year of experimentation, a new, and so far internal, definition of what Wal-Mart stands for will soon become a very public strategy.
articles.abstract: After a tumultuous year of experimentation, a new, and so far internal, definition of what Wal-Mart stands for will soon become a very public strategy.
articles.lead_paragraph: For 44 years, Wal-Mart’s message was “Low prices, always.”

articles.headline: 13 Are Accused of Trading as Insiders
articles.snippet: Federal authorities exposed one of the most far-reaching insider trading schemes on Wall Street in decades.
articles.abstract: Federal authorities exposed one of the most far-reaching insider trading schemes on Wall Street in decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: It started in 2001 with two old friends meeting at the Oyster Bar in the basement of Grand Central Terminal in Manhattan, discussing a $25,000 debt.
articles.byline: By Jenny Anderson and Michael J. de la Merced
